translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

Certain of the government’s refined patriotism and distinguished adherence to the cause in which the valiant people of Rio Grande are engaged, it commissions you with the agency of the monthly subscription decreed on the 10th of last November, as in the authentic board, for the urgencies of the present struggle for our independence; and it counts on Your Lordship

To remit the proceeds of said subscription to the Inspector of the National Treasury in this city. May God keep Your Lordship

Secretary of State for Internal Affairs and Finance in Piratini, September 14, 1837.

Domingos José de Almeida.

Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, Boqueirão. From the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Finance. Received September 28, 1837.
